Package it.unipr.sowide.actodes.examples.simulation

Class PhilosopherState

java.lang.Object
it.unipr.sowide.actodes.examples.simulation.PhilosopherState
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public final class PhilosopherState
extends Object
implements Serializable
The PhilosopherState class maintains the information about the state of a dining philosopher.
See Also:
Serialized Form

    • setForks

      public void setForks​(Reference l, Reference r)
      Sets the references to the two forks.
      Parameters:
      l - the left fork references.
      r - the right fork references.

    • getThinkingTime

      public int getThinkingTime()
      Gets a random value for the thinking time.
      Returns:
      the thinking time.

      public void setThinkingTime​(int l, int h)
      Sets the minimum and maximum value for the thinking time.
      Parameters:
      l - the minimum value (inclusive).
      h - the maximum value (exclusive).

    • getEatingTime

      public int getEatingTime()

      Returns:
      the eating time.

      Parameters:
      l - the minimum value (inclusive).
      h - the maximum value (exclusive).

    • setCatchForks

      public boolean setCatchForks()
      Checks if the philosopher can try to catch the two forks.
      Returns:
      true for enabling the catching.

    • setCatchForks

      public void setCatchForks​(double p)
      Sets the probability to try to catch the two forks.
      Parameters:
      p - the probability.
